intro: Rhizoglossum bergianum, commonly known as the Bergian root tongue, is a rare and specialized plant found in specific alpine environments. It possesses a unique root system that allows it to anchor itself in rocky substrates while absorbing nutrients from the surrounding soil. The plant's morphology includes a short, thick stem with broad, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting to its harsh habitat. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically greenish-white in color, and bloom in early summer. Due to its limited distribution and ecological niche, Rhizoglossum bergianum is considered a sensitive indicator of alpine ecosystem health.
